Hey Brian! Aren't You a little young for a head-tech?
Didn't know I have to do with a military tech-expert...
Do you think there is still a robot research going on?
Tell me, how does this kind of research happen?
Thank You for Your help. Enjoy your leave, Brian.
As I know You understand robots?
As I know You worked on robotics earlier, aren't you?
I'm interested in the research going on Earth.
I think I need to speak with him. Can you help me?
I must speak with the professor. It's very important..
Thank you doc. You helped me a lot.
I see you don't really like these situations.
Do you think an alien could have slipped onto the ship?
Look, I saw someone running out of my room, which was a mess.
Thank you for you advice, Kelly.
Hello Doctor. Do You have some time for me?
I'd like You to tell me about the test I had to complete.
I have some dreams which need rectification...
Thank You for Your time. I have to go now.
The enemy fleet %s has been destroyed.
Message from Governor: Thank you for your escort, Captain. Your reputation does you justice. This sector appears much safer now than before.

Message from Admiral Benson: This takes me back to my early years in the service! Dogfighting is always exciting - eh Captain? I will help you in your forthcoming battles against the Garthog vermin by giving you these lasers. Good hunting, Captain!
BONUS: 16 laser cannons have been added to your storage.
Message from Governor of New Caroline: The destruction of the virus carriers saved many innocent lives. On behalf of those who would have suffered, and for myself, I offer you our deepest gratitude.
Message from money-carrier ship: Good work, Captain. Rest assured that your superiors will be told of your wonderful skill.
Message from a pilot: Great work! If the Garthogs had got their hands on that invention, who knows what damage they could have done?
Your Deputy Officer says: Sometimes, even the governors are a pain.
Message from Trader 1: Thank you for your help, Lieutenant. If you'd arrived any later, I'd be dead for sure!
Message from Trader 2: It's good to see a sheriff back in town! Thank's for your help.
Message from Trader 3: Don't let those pirates escape! Thank you for your quick response. I'll transfer %scr as gratitude.
Message from Trader 4: Excellent! The sight of those pirates running away had made my day! Thanks for the show! Please accept %s credits, as payment for all the fun!
Message from Trader 5: Great shooting, man! Respect due!
Message from Trader 6: Thank you, Commander. I give you %s credits, as payment for your services.
Message from Command HQ: The prototype proved to be successful. It is now ready to be used in full service.
Message from Cargo ship: It warms my heart to see a competent Commander at last! Good work! Please accept this Shield v1.0 as a token of my gratitude.
BONUS: Shield v1.0 added to your storage.
Message from the Governor of Planet Naxos: Our people express their gratitude. Thank you for your help, Captain.
Message from Pirate: You saved my life! Honour dictates I must return the favour, so my gang is ready to help you if required. Farewell, brave Lieutenant.

Before his death, the Garthog fighter sent a message: You have won the battle, Commander, but not the war! We shall not be defeated, we shall hunt you down and destroy you! The Garthogs will rule the Galaxy!
Message from Governor: Thank you for your work, Captain. That was one hell of a battle!
BONUS: You are awarded the Honour of Blue Moon in acknowledgement of your strategic skills.
Message from Trader 7: Thanks for your help, Commander. By the way, could you tell me where I could purchase some weapons?
Message from Trader 8: It was about time someone taught those Garthogs a lesson. I will report this to your commanding officer.
BONUS: You have received a MEDAL OF COURAGE from the Free Traders Alliance. Your reputation has grown among the merchants!
Message from Governor: Thank you for the successful intervention, Captain.
Your own fleet %s has been destroyed.
The AI Development Center increases your colony's knowledge of Artificial Intelligence, which increases your Development capabilities.
Apartment blocks are more expensive to build than prefab housing but can provide living space for more people.
Arcologies are expensive to build but allow the largest population of colonists per square meter.
Banks provide financial investments for local commerce increasing trade and income on the colony.
Increase the commerce to 2.5-times, the energy- and worker-demand to 125%.
Increase the commerce to 3-times, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
A social space where colonists bond with one another through the shared ritual consumption of perception altering substances such as NeoPro Brandy, bars raise colony morale.
The Barracks is the simplest fortifications available. During a ground assault it will fire on nearby enemy tanks and allows you to house four tanks of your own for defense.
The Bunker is a heavily reinforced concrete and neo-titanium bomb shelter that the civilian population retreats to when the colony is attacked, reducing deaths in orbital/ground assaults.
Spiritual Indoctrination Centers, Churches foster the belief in an ephemeral spiritual reward for worldly suffering, increasing colony morale at very low cost.
The Civil Engineering Development Center increases your colony's knowledge of Civil Engineering, which increases your Development capabilities.
The colony hub is the prefabricated colony center automatically deposited on planet by a colonization ship. You can only build other structures on a planet if you have a colony hub.
The Computer Development Center increases your colony's knowledge of Computer Technology, which increases your Development capabilities.
The Equipment factory increases the colony's equipment production capacity.
Increases the capacity to 125%, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
Increases the capacity to 150%, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
Increases the capacity to 175%, the energy- and worker-demand to 250%.
Increases the capacity to 200%, the energy- and worker-demand to 250%.
The Field Telescope is a high powered and focused radio wave detector that can be used to find enemy fleets at a greater range than the Radar Telescope.
Fire brigades automatically repair damaged colony structures up to 50%- free of charge. They are very useful when a colony is being bombarded from orbit or assaulted by ground forces.
Increase the repair to 55%, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
Increase the repair to 61%, the energy- and worker-demand to 175%.
Increase the repair to 68%, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
Increase the repair to 77%, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
Increases the production, the energy- and worker-demand to 125%.
Increases the production, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
Increases the production, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
Increases the production to 250%, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
The Fortress greatly improves your colony's defenses against ground assaults. It fires are enemy tanks and has storage space for eight of your own defensive tanks.
The Fusion Plant is most effective on planets with a ready supply of fusible materials (deuterium, tritium, helium-2). Buildable only on Earth-type and Icy planets.
Hospitals improve colony morale and health, fight disease and find solutions to the challenges of life on alien planets allowing the population to grow more quickly.
Increase the capacity to 125%, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
Increase the capacity to 150%, the energy- and worker-demand to 175%.
Increase the capacity to 175%, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
Increase the capacity to 200%, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
Increase the capacity, the energy- and worker-demand to 125%.
Increase the capacity, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
Increase the capacity to 200%, the energy- and worker-demand to 175%.
Increase the capacity to 250%, the energy to 200% and worker-demand to 175%.
The Hydroponic Food Farm facility grows natural foods in an unnatural environment, extracting maximum yields from such exciting foodstuffs as grains, fungi, and algae.
Utilizing the warping effects of millions of micro-singularities to absorb weapons fire, The Hyper shield protects your colony from Destructors and Virus Bombs.
The Inversion Shield consists of carefully balanced fields of gravitons with reversed spin, which form a highly repulsive barrier around your colony protecting from attacks from space.
The Ion Projector is used to protect your colony from attack by enemy starfleets. It fires a stream of high energy charged particles that can damage most enemy ships.
The Mechanics Development Center increases your colony's knowledge of Mechanics, which increases your Development capabilities.
The Meson Projector fires a stream of subatomic particles that decay into highly explosive matter. These projectors can easily cripple an unsuspecting starship with a single blast.
The Military Development Center increases your colony's knowledge of Military Technology, which increases your Development capabilities.
Military spaceports allow the construction and support of military spaceships. They also can provide some local System Defense Boats to aid in protecting the colony from attacks.
Nuclear Plants use the old-fashioned technology of atomic fission to generate power.
Parks provide a physical reminder of the colonists homeworld. These pleasant, relaxing oasises of faux-nature raise colony morale.
Getting hit by a shot from a Fusion Projector is like running into a small sun. It inflicts severe damage on enemy starships that stray into its range.
The Phased Telescope is the ultimate in long range sensing equipment, accurately pinpointing enemy fleet positions at extreme ranges.
Phood(TM) Factory utilizes the latest advances in genetically engineered MeatBeast(TM), FastGrain(TM) and Sculpted Algae(TM) to produce large quantities of food for hungry colonists.
Plasma projectors fire bolts of superheated matter that can inflict heavy damage on enemy starships.
Police Stations are demanded by the colonists on sufficiently populated worlds to reduce crime to acceptable levels.
Increase the coverage to 125%, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
Increase the coverage to 150%, the energy- and worker-demand to 175%.
Increase the coverage to 175%, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
Increase the coverage to 200%, the energy- and worker-demand to 200%.
Increase the output to 150%, the worker-demand to 125%.
Increase the output to 200%, the worker-demand to 150%.
Increase the output to 250%, the worker-demand to 200%.
Increase the output to 300%, the worker-demand to 200%.
Prefab housing is the cheapest low capacity housing available for your colonists. It comes in four exciting designer interior colors: puce, aquamarine, chiffon, and plaid.
The Radar Telescope detects nearby enemy fleets in space, helping to give warning before enemy attacks.
The Recreation center provides such healthy entertainments as Hyperpool, FlashPong, and Billiards. These entertainments improve morale on the colony.
Advanced, super-efficient photovoltaics combined with high-temperature superconductors and orbital light focusing field arrays make Solar plants the most efficient power source.
The Spaceship factory increases the colony's spaceship production capacity.
The stadium provides a location for performances and sporting events to be put on for the colonists. Full Contact Arcturian Rules Football has proven very effective at raising morale.
The Stronghold is the heaviest fortification you can build to defend your colony against ground attacks. It fires at nearby enemy tanks and provides hangar bays for twelve tanks.
The trade center forms the hub of colonial commerce, the presence of one increases weekly trade income.
Increase the credit income, the energy- and worker-demand to 125%.
Increase the credit income, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
Integrated commercial spaceports, automated customs processing facilities, robot dockworkers and the Spacemerchant's Guild make the Traders' spaceport a valuable revenue source.
Increase the credit income, the energy- and worker-demand to 125%.
Increase the credit income, the energy- and worker-demand to 150%.
Restore to default level (e.g., the post build level).
Moisture Vaporators extract moisture from the air to provide drinking supplies. Water deficient planets need Vaporators to avoid slow population growth.
The Weapon factory increases the colony's weapon production capacity.

In order to produce larger ships, you need to build an orbital space factory as larger ships must be assembled in space. First, you need to develop the orbital space factory. When it has been developed, start production. Once a factory is produced, go to the equipment screen and click on a planet (in the small starmap). Once you have selected the planet, click on the space stations icon (bottom left hand corner). Click on the Orbital Space Factory, and click on the Add icon to equip the planet with the station.

Once a space station is produced, go to the equipment screen and click on a planet (in the small starmap). Once you have selected the planet, click on the space stations icon (bottom left hand corner). Click on the selected space station, and click on the Add icon to equip the planet with the new station.

It is very important to obtain information about planets. If a planet's name is not visible, it means you have not established contact with the planet. It could be empty, or have alien colonies on it. First, you need to deploy a satellite to establish contact and retrieve vital statistics, e.g. if the planet is habitable or not. If you have a SAT in stock and click on an empty planet on the starmap you can deploy it by clicking on the add sat icon. It will soon start to relay information on the planet. The information relay will become more substantial as time progresses. If the planet is already inhabited, the satellite may be spotted, and destroyed. The next step would be to deploy a spy satellite. Spy sat 2.0 will relay more information and enable you spy on the alien race's colony of buildings when you select a planet. It will also relay information about the planetary defence forces.

Use the pause function frequently (SPACE). Take your time to decide who you attack and with what. You can select groups by clicking the left mouse button and dragging. Use SHIFT + numbers to create groups. You may reselect these groups by pressing the numbers, e.g. SHIFT 1 will create group 1, SHIFT 2 group 2. If you press 1, then group 1 will be selected. When you attack or defend a colony, first you have to deploy your units. You must place them on the green squares. If you are attacking, you will start from the edge of the map. If you are defending your colony, you will be able to place units near your buildings. If you attack, some of the buildings will fire at you automatically (Garrisons, Fortresses, etc.). Avoid them if possible.

Use the pause function frequently (SPACE). Take your time to decide who you attack and with what. Flagships have large shields, but are slow. Try and refrain from sending them to different locations. You can select groups as well by clicking the left mouse button and dragging. Use SHIFT + numbers to create groups. You may reselect these groups by pressing the numbers, e.g. SHIFT 1 will create group 1, SHIFT 2 group 2. If you press 1, then group 1 will be selected. Flagships can be equipped with rockets that are quite useful against other spaceships, and bombs that can be used to bombard planetary defense systems. Since flagships are the only spaceships capable of carrying ground forces, one way to stop attempts to invade your colonies is to destroy the flagships before they reach your planet. Once all the flagships are destroyed, the ground forces they possessed will also have been disposed of.

On all of the colonies, morale affects your population, growth and tax income. On human colonies, there are special buildings that increase morale, such as the Bar, Recreation Center, Park, Church and Stadium. It is up to you to discover the most effective way to increase morale. Taxation morale can also be raised by building Police Stations. Morale does not change rapidly and you may have to wait some time for your actions to take effect. Morale can also be increased by lowering tax for a while, and then increasing it slightly when the morale level is stable. On alien colonies, you cannot build parks or other "morale-increasing" buildings, but the police will help you. When you take over another race's colony, the alien population will hate you. Lowering their tax and building police stations to maintain order will change their attitude. Bear in mind, that morale does not change quickly.
Very little is known about the Dargslans. Intelligence reports show that they have extremely powerful ground attack forces, as well as a competent space fleet.

The Dribs are a proud race with advanced technology, especially in the fields of mechanics and architecture. They have known of the Dargslan race for a long time, since the Dargslans occupied some Drib territory. Since then, they have hated the Dargslan race.

With the rapid expansion of their empire, tax revenue has increased to a very high level. This partially explains their obsession with money. They have developed a new ground weapon called the anti-missile tank, which is immune to rocket launchers.

Once part of the Old Empire, they declared themselves independent a long time ago. The Free Nations Society has developed rapidly, occupying territories with ease. The Society is well known for their arrogant attitude and contempt for the Empire.
Once part of the Old Empire, the traders left to create a new empire for themselves. They are a peaceful race of traders and enjoy good relations with the Ychoms

The Garthogs are a contemptible and un-trustworthy race, who implant their young with bio-mechanical devices. They have a special interest in mechanics and are renowned for stealing the technology of other races. It is rumored that they destroyed and entire race, known as the Nubs, to obtain their secrets. The Garthog Empire is close to the Human Empire and there has been conflict for 10 years. The Garthogs possess a special ground weapon: the radar jammer vehicle.
The Morgaths are an insular and hostile race. It is rumored that they have powerful spaceships and a special ground weapon: a kamikaze tank. This weapon should be avoided at all costs!

The Pirates are a bunch of outlaws coming from multiple races. They prefer attacking defenseless trade ships and colonies lost all their morale may likely to join them. They have, so far, never attacked a military fleet deliberately.

The Sulleps' are a walike race with a very strict social structure. From a very young age, Sulleps' are subjected to military training. Such is their code of combat, it is more honourable for them to die in battle than surrender.
A Peaceful, trader race. That enjoys good relations with the Free Traders Alliance. Ychoms have a unique way of defending their colonies: each has a mine-deploying saucer.

On colonies, damaged buildings become less effective, e.g. If a Food farm is damaged, people will get less food, morale will drop and eventually your tax level will decrease. You may repair buildings by clicking on them, a panel will open at the top-right corner. If you click on the damage % icon, it will change to repair %. If a building is being repaired, you will see the damage number on it flashing as the repair is being done and the damage percentage decreasing.

Most research options are linked to technology levels. The technology levels are split into 5 areas: Civil Engineering, Mechanics, Computer Technology, Artificial Intelligence and Military Technology. Your capabilities in these five areas are determined by the type and number of Development Centers you have. Each planet you control may only have one development center so you will need to plan carefully in which area to increase. N.B. Your technology levels are only increased if the development centers you have are fully functioning. If a center has over 50% damage, or has no electricity/power the additional benefits will be lost. If you demolish a development center, your technology in that field will also decrease. This is how you can develop new inventions using your planets' resources. If you have 1-Civil Engineering and 2-Military Dev.Centers, and need 2-Civil Engineering and 1-Military Dev.Center to create an invention, you can simply demolish one of your Military Dev.Centers and build a Civil Engineering center on that planet.

Each Cruiser, Destroyer and Flagship can be equipped with several items. Fighters cannot be equipped with weapons or other equipment. The larger a ship is, the more equipment can be fitted. If you click on a ship from your fleet, it can be equipped in the right window, where the key equipment areas or bays are marked with a green square. Click on the green square, and you will be able to choose from the items you can add, e.g. if you have 10 laser 1.0 equipped and the maximum you can have is 14, click on the +1 button to add laser 1.0 from your stock to the equip bay. This way, you may add 4 more until the maximum amount is reached. You can use the equipment bays for the same type of weapons as well, e.g. if an equipped part of the ship has laser 1.0, and you have laser 2.0 in stock, you will first have to remove laser 1.0 from the equip bay in order to replace it with laser 2.0. This may require a bit of a work but it's well worth it. If your equipment pod has laser 1.0, that means you can use that space to add laser type weapons only. You cannot add radars or any other weapon type to the equipment pod that supports lasers. In order to equip items to your ship, you need to be near one of your planets which has a military spaceport built on it. This spaceport provides short range transfer ships which will transport the items from your stock pile to the spaceship and equip them. Some spaceships come with standard equipment, like hyperdrives. These come as standard with the ship. They cannot be removed and you cannot equip any other items to this bay. When your spaceship gets damaged, the equipment parts also sustain damage. In this instance the green squares representing the equipment pods will turn yellow for (medium damage) or red (heavy damage). When bays are damaged, the equipment in the bay is also damaged, e.g. you may lose equipped laser cannons due to sustained hits. That is why it is important to check your spaceship's equipment after battle. The damaged parts will repair after some time but if you lose weapons, you will need to re-equip them.

Your finances depend solely on tax and trade income. Trade income is a long term investment, while tax income will be your main source of earning. Trade income gives you 600 credits/day, if you own a Traders space port. Trade Center creates an income of 1200 credits/day. If you have a bank on the colony, the bank will double all the trade income. Tax income depends on several factors: - the number of people living on the planet, - the taxation level (controlled by you), - taxation morale
If the taxation level is high, (demanding and opressive) it is very likely that the population will be unhappy. The taxation morale will decrease and unrest will spread throughout the colony. On special occasions you may still use high taxation levels, but this cannot be used as a long term strategy. Taxation morale can be increased in several ways. Trade income does not depend on tax morale so it can be used effectively on alien planets to create a stable source of income. Keeping the taxes low will also make the inhabitants feel more secure.
If the Free Nations Society is to remain free, you will need closer, better relations with the Empire.
The Empire offers its friendship to the Free Nations Society. You do not want to experience our enmity.
All who oppose the Empire are ultimately destroyed. We desire better diplomatic relations with the Free Nations Society.
The Empire and the Free Nations Society would benefit from a close relationship
We feel it would be to our mutual benefit if diplomatic relations were to improve between us.
The Free Nations Society will gain as much from better relations between our nations as the Empire will.
The Empire asks the Free Nations Society to join us in friendship.
The Free Nations Society has shown us the value of your political system. The Empire would be honored by close ties between us.
The Empire has much to learn from the Free Nations Society. Will you give us the honor of closer diplomatic ties?
The Free Nations Society recognizes the wisdom of your words, Admiral!
The Administrative Council sees great things coming of closer relations.
The Empire is worthy of better relations with the Free Nations Society.

Powerful shields, heavy weaponry, and capable of carrying ground assault forces. Since these has to be built in space, an orbital factory is needed to produce them.
A bit slower than the Mammoth, the Python's firepower is far superior. The ground unit payload has also been enlarged and its shields are much stronger.
The Kraken has heavy shields, massive firepower, and the capability to land a fully equipped army on enemy worlds. The Kraken is the jewel of the Empire's fleets.
The Behemoth uses a spun-titanium weave armor plate for unparalleled defense. Fire range: 5, Speed: 3, Armor: 7
Destructors are used for attacking ground based targets from space. They are needed to take out ground based defenses.
An improved destructor, it has a large blast radius and kills thousands of colony inhabitants if they are unprotected.
Bunkers are heavily reinforced structures which provide your colonists with a safe haven during attacks by enemy forces, greatly reducing casualties.
The Colonization ship is used to establish colonies. These immense vessels carry construction tools, colonists, everything needed for a new start on a virgin planet.
Another leftover from the Old Empire, it is outdated but cheap and readily available.
The designers concentrated on the shield generators of this upgrade to the Thunder Class, but this additional mass without stronger drives made it a bit sluggish.
Advanced drive systems, coupled with heavier armor, and cutting edge targeting and fire control make this the most feared cruiser in the Empire's arsenal.
The special unit of the Dargslans. It is capable of repair itself during battle.
This is the most commonly encountered light destroyer. A leftover from the times of the Old Empire, its main advantage is its low cost and ready availability.
The Warrior Class are just refitted Guardian Class destroyers, well equipped with more modern weaponry, but still vulnerable due to a low power shield generator.
The Jabberwocky Class is the pinnacle of destroyer development. Good shields, heavy firepower, and a dual magnetic ram-pump drive system for high speed and versatility.
The special unit of the Dribs. It paralizes multiple enemy vehicles which can't move or fire.
The special unit of the Ecalep. It jams rockets in its surrounding.
The Electronic Counter Measureme detects incoming missiles, and redirects them. The more time the ECM has to detect the missile, the more reliable it is.
The Shocker ECM is an active countermeasures system. Using lasers, radio burst beams gravitic pulse fields and neutrino emitters it confuses and diverts missile attacks.
The Field Telescope is a high powered and focused radio wave detector that can be used to find enemy fleets at a greater range than the Radar Telescope.
The Raptor is a simple no-frills fighter craft. It is armed with dual laser cannons and has a low powered magnetic deflection shield for defense.
The Valkyrie is a superior fighter to the Raptor in every respect. It has a quad laser battery for firepower, a higher gauss mag-def shield and more powerful drives.
Carrying a dual twin laser weapons load the Hammerhead is an incremental improvement on the Valkyrie. It also has a new shield design with high capacity field inductors.
The Streak is a deadly craft, swift and lethal. 4 twin lasers, coupled with the most advanced drive tech available. When designed, it became a serious threat in combat.
The WraithFighter utilizes advances in stealth technology combined with a new phase coupled dipole mag deflector shield array to achieve an almost unhittable fighter.
The Strikebomber is a heavy craft designed for dropping unguided high yield bombs on heavy craft. It is a real threat but must have a fighter escort for optimal effect.
The Thorin is the only surviving Leviathan Class Flagship. It is significantly more powerful than the Kraken Class Flagship.
The Fortress fires at nearby enemy vehicles. It also provides hangar bays and support equipment for your planetary garrisons.
The special unit of the Garthog. It jams any radar car or spy satellite, hiding their numbers and locations on the minimap.
Used by the Garthogs against the Empire in the early stages of the conflict.
The Rhino Heavy Tank is the core of the Empire's ground forces. Fire range: 4 Speed: 4, Armour: 6
Experimental telescope which is capable to detect even the smaller fleets.
A powerful Radar Telescope Satellite named after a famous Old Earth scientific satellite. The Hubble 2 can detect enemy fleets over very large distances.
This upgrades some of your spaceships. They will be able to travel 15% faster with this improved drive system.
The upgraded spaceships will be able to travel 20% faster, with 15% less fuel consumption.
This module upgrades your flagships. Two extra boosters help increase the speed of the ship by 22%.
Your upgraded ships will be able to travel 30% faster than their original speed.
High fuel consuption is the only disadvantage of this thruster system. It provides a 35% speed upgrade, with a 20% boost in maneuverability.
Utilizing the warping effects of millions of micro-singularities to absorb weapons fire, The Hyper shield protects your colony from Destructors and Virus Bombs.
The Inversion Shield consists of carefully balanced fields of gravitons with reversed spin, protecting your colony from Destructor fire from orbiting ships.
The Ion Gun fires streams of positive and negatively charged ions. The two streams maintain cohesion until impact where the streams collapse in a huge blast.
The Laser has been a common weapon since the early 21st century. Accurate and efficient its main drawback is its lack of damage dealing capability.
The Pulse Laser is a simple upgrade, increasing the rate of fire, and thus the amount of energy delivered to the target ship.
Advances in high wavelength focusing techniques allow the UV Laser to deliver significantly higher energy output, increasing the lethality of the weapon.
Once the basic technique was perfected it was a simple step to upgrade the Pulse Laser to the focusing system. This is the most powerful laser available.
This Cougar Light Tank is often used as a recon vehicle due to its speed and armor. Fire range: 2, Speed: 5, Armor: 3
Trading speed for armor and range, the Tiger is a battlefield mainstay. Fire range: 4, Speed: 4, Armor: 4
The ultimate weapon, the Meson Gun sprays short lived micro-singularities, easily crippling fleets of fighter craft.
The Meson Projector fires a stream of subatomic particles that decay into highly explosive matter. These projectors can easily cripple an unsuspecting starship.
The special unit of the Morgath. Upon imminent destruction or commander decision, it can trigger a self-destruct mechanism which damages nearby vehicles.
This missile when explodes will burst into small multi-head explosives, which clear a large area of fighter aircrafts.
Orbital Factories provide the zero-g construction facilities needed to build your gigantic flagships.
The Neutron Gun is an improvement on the Ion Gun. Instead of charged ions it fires electrically neutral neutrons which increases beam cohesion and fire rate.
The Fusion Projector fires a magnetic bottle fusing hydrogen. It inflicts severe damage on enemy starships that stray into its range.
The Phased Telescope is the ultimate in long range sensing equipment, accurately locating enemy fleets at extreme ranges.
With a few key breakthroughs in nanotechnology, genetic engineering, and marketing to sell the repulsive slop, the Phood(TM) Factory is an effective food source.
The Plasma Gun fires a burst of superheated matter. A direct hit shatters hull plates with heat and shorts out electrical systems, crippling the target.
Plasma Projector fires bolts of superheated matter that can inflict heavy damage on enemy starships.
The Radar Array can be equipped onto any of your spaceships. It detects any ships within 2 parsecs.
The Focused Field Radar Array can be equipped onto any of your spaceships. It detects any ships within 5 parsecs.
The Phased Field Array is a series of tuned Radar Arrays which can be carried by a flagship, their combined power detects and identifies spaceships and planets as well.
The Radar Car is a specialized recon vehicle with powerful side-looking radar, lidar, and magnetic detectors.
The Radar Telescope detects nearby enemy fleets in space, helping to give warning before enemy attacks.
The STK-1 is a simple missile, carrying a high explosive load and using an uncomplicated turn and track targeting system. Maneuverability: 6 Speed: 500
This new version of the STK-1 is more manuverable and faster. Manuverability: 8 Speed: 850
Vulnerable, but fast and agile, the Rocket Sled is a hit and run raider. Fire range: 7, Speed: 6.5, Armor: 2
The Heavy Rocket Sled sacrifices armor for speed and more powerful rockets. Fire range: 8, Speed: 7, Armor: 1
The Survey Satellite is used to gather information on unexplored and unknown planets.
Using higher gauss mag-def fields than standard shields, this upgrade increases the shield strength of the ships by 10%.
Also utilizing higher gauss mag-def fields this upgrade increases the shield power of ships by 15%.
This unit upgrades the shield power by 20%. It uses a pulsed field technology.
Like the Medium Shield, this is a redesign of the core mag-def technology. Pulsed EM fields upgrade the shield power of flagships by 25%.
Advances in key technologies such as magnetohydrodynamics, optics, photovoltaics, and superconductors, are needed for the construction of this advanced power source.
Space Stations are used to protect your planets from attack. They have heavy firepower and strong hull. They are the key to an effective defense.
The Giant has massive firepower, and is capable of putting up a stiff resistance to enemy fleets that attempt to assault the planets it guards.
The Colossus is the largest of all defensive stations. It can be a formidable foe for even the largest of starships.
Spy Satellites are used to detect and monitor alien communications, activities and fleet movements.
This upgraded Spy Satellite has significant stealth enhancements and better sensors to detect and report on the ships and space bases around enemy planets.
This allows flagships to carry 3 additional ground vehicles.
The Heavy Cargo Pod gives the flagship to which it is retrofitted room for an additional 5 ground vehicles.
The Stronghold is the heaviest fortification available for defending your colonies from ground based assaults.
The special unit of the Sullep. It has a longer fire range than most vehicles and its shells do area damage.
The Trade center is a useful installation for increasing commerce, prosperity, and tax income on your colonies.
Fairly basic ship capable of transporting 100 metric tons of equipment or material and 50 passengers.
Advanced ship capable of transporting 250 metric tons of equipment or material and 150 passengers.
The Virus bomb carries a payload of particularly virulent prions which are capable of killing all known lifeforms. After the planet is 'cleansed' the virus dies out.
The special unit of the Ychom. Unarmed vehicle, but it places high-explosive mines which can destroy most vehicles.
I lack self-confidence when it comes to relationships! Do these feelings describe your inner emotions?
I am always confident in relationships.
If I need to make spur of the moment decisions, my responses are often:
When I have minor problematic issues, am I still optimistic?
Do I ever let my emotions get the better of me?
An inspiring piece of poetry is of more importance than the most powerful weapon.
Nothing compares to a well authored poem.
It depends on the mood I'm in.
Mass destruction is the biggest thrill of all.
I am strong enough to face my fears.
When I get the blame for situations beyond my control, I feel
Because rationality does not always get the desired response, you may have to resort to extreme measures!
At the drop of a hat.
Optional. Go to the bridge and ask for reinforcements.
Handle the needs of the colonies. Start fortifying colonies.
Produce fighters, destroyers and any equipment they need.
Try to build at least one Barracks.
Build factories and try constructing ships and equipment.

We suggest that the Garthog Empire considers an alliance with the Galactic Empire, or else, the next call will go to the fleets.
Alliance with us is not mandatory but strongly recommended for lesser races...
Who is not with us is against us, Councilor. I hope you understand me?
Our forces are strong by themselves but would be unstoppable together. What do you think about it, Councilor?
Let's put our differences aside, since together, we could conquer the whole galaxy!
What's the sense of this war started by our grandfathers? If we ally we could concentrate on our true enemies.
We offer our frendship to the mighty Garthog Empire.
We would be honored to fight along the Garthogs against the other pathetic races.
If two such strong empire joined forces, we would be unstoppable, Councilor!
We agree that such alliance would be beneficial for both sides.
The council accepted the proposal by a small majority of votes.
You proved you are worthy of our respect. So be it!
Our people are hard to forget, Admiral. I'll see what I can do.
Resistance is still high against Earthlings. I'm not sure such agreement could be done.
Who do you think you are, earthling? We don't need anything from you!
Ridiculous human worm! You are going to beg to me.
I'll personally cut out your tongue for how you talk to me!
I never thought this day will come, but the council has voted for the alliance between Earthings and Garthogs.
We accept the proposal for a while...
I'm not sure if this was your best idea ever, human.
The Council will perhaps consider this matter the next year.
The time will come for this one day, perhaps.
Our races take different roads and we don't have incentive for commonalities.
We would rather pass on this, Admiral.
Okay, we would feel sorry for wasting our battleships on you anyway.
It would be waste of rockets anyway. At least we will have time to fight a worthy enemy.
Finally you found the proper tone. So be it, let's create an alliance between the two nation!
It would be too early to talk about it.
We can't comment on the matter in the current phase.
If I were you, I would return my admiralty mandate, you puny little dog.
Both you and what you say is ridiculous!
Beg all you want, earthling, there will be no mercy!
We decided we offer %s credits to help the Garthog Empire.
Your generocity will be remain without thanks!
Although we have plenty of money, we appreciate your offer.
The grant amount will be used to help Garthog orphants.
You are pathetic, one by one. Keep your money!
What would we do with this money? I even earn more than that!
If we made a trade agreement, both nations would gain more money for researching technologies.
Well said, Admiral. Trade is money and money is technology.
We can try, but don't even try to fool us.
We see some fantasy in the idea.
We don't need such human clowny things.
There is no money in trading, only waste of time.
We know your tactics, Admiral. Your trader ships will be infested with spies. Our answer: No.
%s continuously violates the integrity of our common border. It's time to reckon with them!
Ships of %s regularly make raids in our sector. Death to them!
We agree that such impudence can't be tolerated.
Our Council believes that together, the fleets of %s can be crushed into powder within weeks.
We battle on too many fronts already. We don't need another one.
We won't fight your battles instead of you!
We rather watch as %s stomps your pathetic empire.
The Dargslans expand without limit and they are too strong for us to stop them alone. We must unite for the sake of our future!
The Dargslan Kingdom are like a pest infecting the Galaxy. We will help you stop the pandemic.
You are right, Admiral. They must be erradicated!
Together we truly have a chance against them.
It would be foolish to anger the Dargslan aginst us.
It's out of question, Admiral. We are not light-headed.
It is stupid to engage into such war without having any chance.
Although it had better moments, no doubt the Garthog Empire is on the brink of downfall. To reduce civilian causalities, we offer the option to surrender.
Indeed, we have no choice but to surrender.
With aching heart and bitter mouth we surrender.
This is a shameful day for the Garthogs. We surrender.
You stupid nobody! You are gonna beg for your life to me!
There is no more pathetic than a human liar.
I would shoot myself before I became your slave, dog!
Other important matters of the Empire require my attention now.
We surrender, just to corrupt your empire from inside.
It is a shameful day for the Garthogs, but we don't have any choice. We surrender.
The true warrior knows when there is no reason to fight. This moment has come for the Garthogs.
We are willing to make alliance with the human nations.
The Council has voted for an alliance between the two empires.
You have been proven worthy to treat you as a human being. The Garthog Empire is ready for an alliance.
If we made peace, no more Garthogs need to die. And humans either...
This war is pointless, none of us can win. Wouldn't it better to make peace, Admiral?
Admiral, please consider the possibility of making peace between the two nations.
If we get %s credits, you might live to see the next day.
Many Garthogs say the alliance with you has no benefits. Maybe with %s credits I could convince them otherwise.
Fighting for you caused lots of losses on our side. %s credits would make us forget our sorrow...
We have no other choice but to burn every planet the humans stepped upon.
With aching heart we have to erradicate the infection your people represent in the galaxy.
This is your last chance, Admiral! If you do not surrender now, we will erradicate all traces of your miserable human nation.
If you do not give up the war, you are going to watch the remaining of your planets burst into flames!
You get a last chance to give up, Admiral. Nobody can say the Garthogs are not civilized.

Your promiscuious race gains %.0f%% growth rate on all kinds of planets. Conquered planets pick up this habit as well.
Being single, or having no or few children, is accepted by your culture, resulting in %.0f%% growth rate on all planets. Conquered planets get so depressed they exhibit the same behavior.
Your civilization discovered fractional reserve banking before the wheel, granting you %.0f%% more tax and trade income.
Your monetary minister is the guru G. M., so tax aversion, unemployment and black market thrives in your empire. Your tax and trade income is reduced by %.0f%%.
Your race always loved to have strong defenses. Therefore, space stations, planetary shields and planetary guns gain %.0f%% hitpoints.
Your race never really cared about defense properties of your planets. Therefore, space stations, planetary shields and planetary guns lose %.0f%% hitpoints.
Your race simply loves guns and explosions. All damage dealt by your forces increase by %.0f%%.
Either your race was scientifically incapable or just to pacifistic, the damage dealt by your forces is decreased by %.0f%%.
Your race are better at sciences and can research technology at %.0f%% less cost and time.
Your race gets ideas and scientific processes at a much slower rate, which means %.0f%% more cost and time per research.
Your ancestors always looked at the stars with fascination. And they even managed to find some nearby planets.

Astronomers, perhaps due they get bored with their own planet, have mapped the entire galaxy of habitable planets and are quite ready to send satellites to explore them. You'll find them in your inventory.
Your speech skills impress the most hard-hearted aliens. You gain %.0f%% chance they will agree to your terms.
Diplomacy is not your strong skill. You lose %.0f%% chance they will agree to your terms.
Skilled engineers will repair your fleet without military spaceports, although at a much lower rate. However, your shields will regenerate faster between battles.
Your engineers are brave enough to help you fix and regenerate your shields during battles, so long as the shield generator isn't destroyed.
Spy Centers support a single operative and play the major role in spying against enemy empires.

[c=FFFFCC00]Builds and upgrades civil buildings, such as houses, food factories and hospitals, on demand.[/c][n]If necessary, power plants are built or upgraded as well.[n]This setting might be used to keep planets well supplied.[n]It tries to upgrade buildings first before building new ones to save space.

[c=FFFFCC00]Builds and upgrades economic buildings, such as traders spaceport, bank, etc.[/c][n]If necessary, power plants are built or upgraded as well.[n]Best used to ensure these kinds of buildings are available and upgraded on all planets.

[c=FFFFCC00]Builds and upgrades factory buildings: spaceship-, equipment- and weapons factories.[/c][n]If necessary, power plants are built or upgraded as well.[n]Best used ensure these kinds of buildings are available and upgraded on all planets.

[c=FFFFCC00]Builds morale-boosting buildings, such as church, police, bar, stadium, etc.[/c][n]If necessary, power plants are built or upgraded as well.[n]Best used to ensure these kinds of buildings are available on all planets.

[c=FFFFCC00]Upgrades any upgradable buildings to their maximum (as money permits).[/c][n]If necessary, power plants are built or upgraded as well.[n]Best used to ensure buildings are upgraded on all planets.

[c=FFFFCC00]Performs all kinds of management tasks automatically:[/c][n]- builds or upgrades buildings based on population demands,[n] including special demands such as Stadium or Fire Brigade,[n]- builds and/or upgrades power plants, replaces them with more efficient ones if they become available,[n]- builds factories and economic buildings, then upgrades them to maximum,[n]- Builds morale-boosting buildings such as Church and Bar,[n]- Builds a Military Spaceport,[n]- Builds Radar, Shields, Barracks and planetary guns and[n] replaces them if a newer version becomes available.[n]- Produces and/or deploys tanks, fighters, starbases up to the maximum capacity, replaces them if newer versions become available[n]- Adjusts the tax level to keep the population happy enough but tries to maximize the tax income[n][n][c=FFFFCC00]Notes and warnings:[/c][n]- Tanks and rocket sleds are deployed in 2/3 + 1/3 mix, plus one per special units.[n]- Places production orders which might disrupt the main production the user intended.[n]- Builds an Orbital Factory if there aren't any in the empire.[n]- If multiple planets have this mode, they are handled in order of their problems or demands.
